alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 12:18PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Weber...southeastern Box Elder...western Davis and northeastern Tooele Counties through 100 PM MDT... At 1217 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Grantsville, moving northeast at 45 mph. Additional thunderstorms are developing across the southwest shore of the Great Salt Lake. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Layton, Hill Air Force Base, Roy, Clearfield, Syracuse, Clinton, South Ogden, Washington Terrace, Riverdale, Hooper, South Weber, Marriott-Slaterville, Uintah, Weber State University, Great Salt Lake South of the Causeway, West Haven, West Point, Plain City and Sunset. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 334 and 345. Interstate 84 between mile markers 82 and 86. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 75 and 86. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A severe thunderstorm watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northern Utah.
